alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 10:59PM PST until December 07 at 8:12AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .Heavy rain over the North Central Cascades has come to an end. The Skagit has crested upstream at Concrete. The flood crest will make its way down to Mount Vernon Wednesday. The forecast crest at Mount Vernon has been lowered out of the major flooding category to the moderate flooding category. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Mt. Vernon. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, the Skagit River will flood from Sedro Woolley downstream through Mount Vernon to the mouth. Flood waters will inundate some low-lying roads...farmlands and residential areas. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a phase 3 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 27.6 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late Tuesday evening with the river cresting near 31.1 feet late Wednesday morning. The river will begin receding Wednesday afternoon falling below flood stage Wednesday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 700 AM PST.
